verses.verse: And it came to pass after <WH310> the death <WH4194> of Saul <WH7586>, when David <WH1732> was returned <WH7725> from the slaughter <WH5221> of the Amalekites <WH6002>, and David <WH1732> had abode <WH3427> two <WH8147> days <WH3117> in Ziklag <WH6860>;

And David <WH1732> said <WH559> unto the young man <WH5288> that told <WH5046> him <WH559>, Whence art thou? And he answered, I am the son <WH1121> of a sojourner <WH376>, an Amalekite <WH6003>.

And David <WH1732> lamented <WH6969> with this lamentation <WH7015> over Saul <WH7586> and over Jonathan <WH3083> his son <WH1121>

Ye mountains <WH2022> of Gilboa <WH1533>, Let there be no dew <WH2919> nor rain <WH4306> upon you <WH7704>, neither fields of offerings <WH8641>: For there the shield <WH4043> of the mighty <WH1368> was vilely cast away <WH1602>, The shield <WH4043> of Saul <WH7586>, not anointed <WH4899> with oil <WH8081>.
